CONF_PARAM_1.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The duration of one cycle of descent, submerged drift, ascent and transmission. The NOVA Profiling Float waits submerged at the parking depth for as long as necessary to make the cycle the selected duration.
CONF_PARAM_1.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: For APEX and ARVOR floats this is the total duration of one cycle, usually 240 hours (10 days). For SOLO floats this is the total duration of one cycle, assuming that all float operations reach their full time-out intervals before moving to the next float stage. Typically the actual cycle time will be shorter than this value.

CONF_PARAM_2.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: This is the number of cycles of descent, submerged drift, ascent and transmission that NOVA will perform. The mission ends and NOVA enters Life Expiry mode when this number of cycles has been completed. Note: when PARAM 1 = 255 the number of cycles is infinite.
CONF_PARAM_2.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Applies to PROVOR and ARVOR floats, profiler configuration - Number of cycles before float turns itself off, goes into end of life mode, or into recovery mode

CONF_PARAM_3.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: GMT hour of the day to begin ascent profiles, according to 24-hour clock.
CONF_PARAM_3.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Preset time to start ascent profile, if units = MINUTES (in minutes past midnight), if units = HH (24 hour clock)

CONF_PARAM_4.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The time interval between successive measurements during ascent.
CONF_PARAM_4.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period during the ascending profile (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_5.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The time interval between successive measurements during descent.
CONF_PARAM_5.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period during the descent to parking pressure (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_6.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The time interval between successive measurements during NOVA’s stay at the drift depth.
CONF_PARAM_6.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: specifies sampling period during the park phase, e.g. for APEX floats could be hourly or for ARVOR floats 12 hourly, for SOLO/SOLOII floats this definition is: P,T,S is sampled during drift (park) every CONFIG_ParkSamplingPeriod_hours, e.g. every 2 hours.

CONF_PARAM_7.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The depth at which NOVA drifts after completion of a descent while awaiting the time scheduled for the beginning of the next ascent.
CONF_PARAM_7.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: park pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_8.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Depth to begin an ascending profile. If NOVA is drifting at some shallower depth, it will first descend to the profile depth before starting the ascent profile.
CONF_PARAM_8.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: profile pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_9.CONF_PARAM_LABEL: Duration from Parking to Profile Depth
CONF_PARAM_9.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The number of hours before the Ascent time (PARAM 2) that parking will end.
CONF_PARAM_9.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: maximum amount of time allowed for the float to descend to Profile pressure from Park pressure

CONF_PARAM_10.CONF_PARAM_LABEL: Depth Interval for CTD Data Reduction
CONF_PARAM_10.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The target depth interval between final CTD samples. A small interval gives a more highly resolved profile and larger messages.
CONF_PARAM_10.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Target depth interval between final CTD samples when a the spot sampling mode.

CONF_PARAM_11.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The time delay between activation and the float becoming operational on its mission.
CONF_PARAM_11.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Float waiting period before the first cycle of its mission (in minutes).

CONF_PARAM_12.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The interval between housekeeping messages at the end-of-life.
CONF_PARAM_12.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the Iridium transmission when in End Of Life mode (in minutes).

CONF_PARAM_13.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Set this to zero (0) to set an immediate profile post deployment, after which the cycle period applies.
CONF_PARAM_13.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Profiler configuration - Reference day, for PROVOR and ARVOR floats this is: The day number on which the first profile is to be made. The day when the mission starts is zero.

CONF_PARAM_14.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: The float can perform descending profiles or ascending profiles or both.

CONF_PARAM_15.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Maximum duration of valve at surface
CONF_PARAM_15.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum duration of the additional valve actions performed at the surface during the buoyancy reduction phase.

CONF_PARAM_16.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Maximum of oil volume transfered via the valve during descent
CONF_PARAM_16.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the valve action durations. The valve flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMaxPerValveAction_cm^3 is converted to a maxDurationOfValveAction.  During descent phases the float regularly computes a valve duration to sink to the target depth. In some specific cases the result can be a huge valve action duration and the result must be thresholded by maxDurationOfValveAction.

CONF_PARAM_17.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Minimum of oil volume transfered via the valve during descent
CONF_PARAM_17.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the valve action durations. The valve flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMinPerValveAction_cm^3 is converted to a minDurationOfValveAction.  During descent phases the float regularly computes a valve duration to sink to the target depth. In some specific cases the result can be a brief valve action duration and the result must be thresholded by minDurationOfValveAction.

CONF_PARAM_18.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Maximum pump activation during depth correction
CONF_PARAM_18.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum duration of the pump action for a drift readjustment.

CONF_PARAM_19.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Max value of pump activation during ascending profile
CONF_PARAM_19.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum duration of a pump action during ascent.

CONF_PARAM_20.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Pump activation at surface after emptying the reservoir
CONF_PARAM_20.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the last pump action of the buoyancy acquisition phase.

CONF_PARAM_21.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Waiting delay after end of ascent pressure threshold was reached
CONF_PARAM_21.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: At the end of the ascent phase, when the float detects a given pressure (Ex: 6 dbar) it waits for this time delay before starting the pump for the final buoyancy acquisition.

CONF_PARAM_22.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Pump activation required to empty the reservoir
CONF_PARAM_22.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum duration of the last pump action of the buoyancy acquisition phase.

CONF_PARAM_23.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float ascent to surface.

CONF_PARAM_24.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time delay after each valve action before checking the pressure during the buoyancy reduction phase.

CONF_PARAM_25.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float descent.

CONF_PARAM_26.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float drift at park or profile depth.

CONF_PARAM_27.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Pressure sampling period during stabilization phase
CONF_PARAM_27.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float stabilization phases.

CONF_PARAM_28.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Error on pressure target when positioning at parking
CONF_PARAM_28.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation at parking depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_29.CONF_PARAM_LABEL: Nb samples out of tolerance for repositioning
CONF_PARAM_29.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Maximum number of pressure samples out of the tolerance before repositioning
CONF_PARAM_29.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of consecutive pressure measurements outside the target pressure interval before performing a drift readjustment.

CONF_PARAM_30.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float drift at parking depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_31.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Emergency ascent phase start pressure (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_32.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Pressure threshold between surface and descent phases
CONF_PARAM_32.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Second threshold of the buoyancy reduction phase (in dbars). From the first threshold to this second threshold, the float performs N2 additional valve actions (of computed durations) until the crossing of this second threshold. The descent to park phase starts at the crossing of this second threshold.

CONF_PARAM_33.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a grounding is detected. 0: the float changes its drift pressure, 1: the float stays on the seabed until the next phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_34.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Maximum number of valve activation before grounding detection at surface
CONF_PARAM_34.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum number of surface valve attempts without change in pressure to set the surface grounding flag.

CONF_PARAM_35.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Cumulated oil transfer without moving using the valve before grounding detection during descent
CONF_PARAM_35.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is a threshold used to detect a grounding of the float. If there is no vertical motion after having tranfered CONFIG_OilVolumeMinForGroundingDetection_cm^3 through the valve, the gounded flag is activated and the float acts as configurated by the CONFIG_GroundingMode_LOGICAL parameter.So, yes it is a configuration parameter (and I can easily understand that it can be modified via remote control since some PROVOR floats have experienced erroneous grounding detection (under study but perhaps due to in-situ conditions).

CONF_PARAM_36.CONF_PARAM_LABEL: Shallowest pressure to apply first grounding mode
CONF_PARAM_36.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Grounding pressure threshold before depth correction is applied
CONF_PARAM_36.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_37.CONF_PARAM_LABEL: Pressure correction for first grounding mode
CONF_PARAM_37.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure to its programmed one minus this value only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_39.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Error on pressure target when positioning at profile depth
CONF_PARAM_39.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation at profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_40.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Pressure tolerance around parking at profile depth
CONF_PARAM_40.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float drift at profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_41.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Depth intervals for shallow depth (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_42.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Thickness of the slices for shallow depths (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_43.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The isobar that divides shallow depths from intermediate depths for the purpose of data reduction with 3 depth zones.

CONF_PARAM_44.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Depth intervals for intermediate depth (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_45.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Thickness of the slices for intermediate depths (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_46.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The isobar that divides intermediate depths from deep depths for the purpose of data reduction with 3 depth zones (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_47.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Depth intervals for bottom depth (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_48.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Thickness of the slices for deep depths (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_49.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Calculate transition bins between depth zones (shallow/intermediate/bottom) (algorithm of data reduction).

CONF_PARAM_50.CONF_PARAM_DEFINITION: Data reduction type (0: bin method, 1: pressure point selection method)
CONF_PARAM_50.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Have to convert string input to LOGICAL (1 = averaged, 0 = spot sampling)
